DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Screening may help doctor find prostate cancer sooner , may easier treat . The amount heterocyclic amine diet may affect prostate cancer screen result risk prostate cancer . PURPOSE : This phase II trial study prostate cancer screen dietary heterocyclic amine African American men .
DOC.brief_title: Prostate Cancer Screening Dietary Heterocyclic Amines African American Men
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Estimate dietary heterocyclic amine ( HA ) exposure African American men use HA-forming meat cook method . - Correlate dietary HA exposure prostate-specific antigen digital rectal exam screen result ( i.e. , high HA exposure increase abnormality prostate cancer screen result ) participant . OUTLINE : This prospective study . Participants complete routine medical questionnaire undergo detail dietary interview focus meat consumption , cook preference , factor may associate prostate cancer risk . Participants undergo digital rectal exam ( DRE ) blood collection prostate-specific antigen ( PSA ) test ( total PSA % free PSA ) . Results PSA test DRE , include follow-up instruction ( need ) , send participant 3-4 week later . Blood sample also examine phenotypic assay UV-damage induced nucleotide excision-repair capacity . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 800 participant accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : African American male No previous diagnosis prostate cancer Desires prostate cancer screen routine preventative medical service PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Lives near Oakland , California Speaks English No medical disability ( e.g. , blindness , psychological dysfunction , amputation ) would preclude study participation PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Not specify
